Rob?

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Thank you, Todd.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Bright and early on the West Coast this morning.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Good morning, everyone.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Welcome to our fourth quarter and year-end earnings conference call.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: I'd like to start with a brief review of our fourth quarter and full year results and then discuss what we're seeing now in the market and what we expect going forward before turning the call over to Peter to give more commentary on the financials.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Starting with the fourth quarter, we're pleased to report our third consecutive quarter of strong sequential and year-over-year revenue growth.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Sales for the quarter came in at $21.1 million, a sequential increase of 38% over the third quarter and up 97% year-over-year.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: On the bottom line, we generated net income of just over $800,000, non-GAAP net income of $1.1 million, and adjusted EBITDA of $1.5 million, all of which were up significantly on a year-over-year basis.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: It's important to note that Q4 also included several one-time charges related to our seasonal year-end performance-based compensation, as well as one-time charges related to M&A activity.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Peter will have more information on that in a few minutes.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: For the full year, sales were up 33% over the prior fiscal year to $57.4 million, and we generated net income of $6.2 million, non-GAAP net income of $7.1 million, and adjusted EBITDA of $2.7 million, all up solidly year over year.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: We saw strong growth in all of our markets and channels for both the quarter and the full fiscal year, reflecting a healthy recovery in our entire business.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: We're pleased to be getting back to the growth plan we laid out in our long-term plan a few years back.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: While we had to pause a bit this past fiscal year under the operational challenges we encountered around the COVID pandemic, we're back to it and feel good about the way we're performing.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: and we expect more growth as we execute our plan to scale our business both organically and through M&A.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: More on that in a moment.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: As I noted last call, we continue to see signs of recovery in all markets and especially in the spending from the wireless carrier ecosystem.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Over the past couple of quarters, we announced several multimillion-dollar orders from a new Tier 1 wireless carrier customer.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: These orders helped to bring our backlog to $33.3 million at the end of our fiscal year on October 31st.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: These sizable orders for our OptiFlex hybrid fiber cable solution highlight the increasing demand for our product offerings as wireless carriers accelerate their network build-outs.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: While our margins were down in the quarter, this was largely driven by the concentrated Tier 1 business and the impact of the current state of the supply chain and material and shipping costs.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: This was not unexpected, given our hybrid fiber solution has been such a large piece of our sales.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: The good news is we feel like we're delivering very well in the business and have been able to drop a significant amount of this revenue to our bottom line.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: I really appreciate the execution of our team at Cables Unlimited in Long Island to perform so well in building and fulfilling these orders in a tough market.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: We love this business, and while margins move around, we saw in 2018 and 2019 that large opportunities like this can transform our customer relationships, open new doors, and drop a large amount of cash onto our balance sheet.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: That gives us increased flexibility to run the business and invest in opportunities both organically and through M&A activity.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: We feel like we're very effective at deploying our resources with a keen eye on providing solid value for our shareholders.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: We do expect that most of the supply chain and material cost issues should normalize over the next few quarters.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: And as always, we also continue to monitor our pricing policies and make changes where necessary to address the overall market conditions and the related cost fluctuations.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: As we look ahead, we see significant room to further increase our gross margins through large opportunities and through an improved product mix that hasn't yet fully materialized, including our higher margin small cell and DAC offerings.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: As I've noted before, the layering of project wins on top of our growing core business gives us confidence that our diverse product platform is a springboard for strong future revenue growth.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: With our complete product offering, we're now doing business with every one of the companies in the wireless tier one ecosystem, including many of the largest tower and neutral host companies.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: As I've noted before, our investments in our sales and business development organization are building positive momentum around new business.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Looking at some of our product areas and market segments, Our core distribution business remains healthy and diverse and continues to grow.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Our RF coaxial cable and connector products and our C Enterprises fast-turn fiber products together make up our primary offers sold through distribution.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Both of these two major product areas showed meaningful growth over the prior fiscal year, and we expect to see steady growth in our new fiscal year as we continue to build our baseline of core revenue.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Turning to our small cell and DAC thermal cooling offerings, These are huge opportunities that we expect will increase sales in the coming year.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Our Shroff Tech business, where these products reside, had their best sales quarter of the year in Q4, and for the full year, we're up meaningfully in sales compared to the prior year.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: The pipeline continues to build, and we have a strong backlog of orders.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: We have product actively shipping to several small sale players, as well as ongoing discussions regarding future deployments with others.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: We've also started field trials with a few large customers, and some smaller projects are also moving forward.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Additionally, we look forward to sharing some product roadmap announcements very soon.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: All of this is giving us increased confidence in the growth prospects of our small cell and DAC business in the new fiscal year.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Now turning to M&A.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: We're excited to have entered into a definitive agreement last week to acquire Microlab, the radio frequency components business of Wireless Telecom Group.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: for an aggregate cash consideration of $24.25 million.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Microlab designs and manufactures high-performance RF and microwave products, enabling signal distribution and deployment of in-building DAS, wireless-based stations, and small cell networks.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Their products are known worldwide for their superior quality and performance and are considered the gold standard in RF and microwave distribution systems.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: For the 12-month period ended September 30th, 2021, They generated unaudited revenue of approximately $16 million and adjusted EBITDA of approximately $3.7 million.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: The transaction has been unanimously approved by the board of directors of both companies and is subject to various terms and conditions, including approval by wireless telecom groups shareholders.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Wireless Telecom Group will file a proxy statement regarding the proposed transaction with the SEC, and the closing of the transaction is anticipated to occur in the first calendar quarter of 2022.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: This acquisition is in line with our strategic plan that we've been working toward to drive revenue growth both organically and through the acquisition of good quality companies with passive components that give us access to new products that we can sell through our growing distribution channel.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: With our focus on the significant growth opportunities we expect to see in servicing the small cell and DAS markets, we believe Microlabs products will provide additional scale and opportunity for further revenue growth.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: With what we know about their product lines, we believe they will also help us take our gross margins up, and we expect the deal to be accretive immediately.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: So to conclude, We remain focused on successfully executing on our long-term growth plan to not only grow organically, but also through acquisitions.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: We're actively engaged with every top-tier company in the carrier ecosystem as a result of the investments in our go-to-market capabilities.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: With our expanded and complete product offering, we continue to grow our baseline business and see significant growth opportunities in small cell and DAC that we expect will increase sales and positively impact our margins in the coming year.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: and our large backlog gives us a nice tailwind as we start our new fiscal year.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: So as we look ahead, the first quarter is typically our toughest quarter seasonally.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: We expect revenue to be down versus Q4, but certainly up significantly over last year's Q1.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: We expect core revenue to increase throughout the year and to generate year-over-year revenue growth in fiscal 2022 of at least 10%, which should put our total sales for fiscal 22 at something more than $63 million.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: This growth rate does not include any microlab revenue for the new fiscal year, and any additional hybrid fiber orders would also be upside to that number as well.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: With that, I'll now turn the call over to Peter for a review and discussion of the financial results for the quarter.

speaker_title_P: President and Chief Executive Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Peter?

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Thank you, Rob, and good morning, everyone.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: As Rob mentioned, we are pleased to report our third consecutive quarter of strong sequential and year-over-year revenue growth for the fourth quarter.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: we saw significant growth in all our markets and channels for both the quarter and the full fiscal year.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Before getting into the comparisons and getting into more detail of our fourth quarter and our full fiscal year results, I do want to note that our fourth quarter results is in a more normalized state as there is no impact from the Paycheck Protection Program loan forgiveness and no impact from the Employee Retention Tax Credit.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: When looking at the full fiscal year results, there will be impact from both the PPP loan forgiveness and the ERC as we recognize those impacts in the second and third quarter of fiscal 2021.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: For comparison purposes, here as I go through our results, I will be excluding the impact of the PPP loan forgiveness and the ERC where applicable to make the results more comparable.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Sales in the fourth quarter were $21.1 million, up 38% sequentially from Q3, and up 97% year-over-year.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: For the full fiscal year, sales increased 33% year-over-year to $57.4 million.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: With our increase in sales, comparisons of our fourth quarter results to the prior quarter were all favorable, whether looking at net income, EPS, or adjusted EBITDA.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Gross profit margin was 25.3% compared to 27.8% in the preceding third quarter.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: And as Rob noted, the decrease in our margin was driven by the concentrated Tier 1 business and the impact of the current state of the supply chain and material and shipping costs.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: This was not unexpected given our hybrid fiber solution has been such a large piece of our backlog, which means we had locked in pricing with our customer for these large orders and margins was impacted by the rising cost of shipping and certain materials as a result of the widely reported supply chain issues.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: We do expect to see the impact of the supply chain and increased costs to continue, but do anticipate it to moderate as the year progresses.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: To offset these rising costs, we are actively monitoring our pricing and making changes where necessary to address the increased costs we are experiencing.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Further, we do see room to improve our margins through improved product mix, which includes large opportunities that we have in our pipeline related to our higher margin small cell and DAC offerings.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Even with the margin impact, a significant amount of this revenue fell to the bottom line.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Operating income was $1.1 million, up from operating income of $393,000 in the preceding third quarter.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: On the bottom line, we generated fourth quarter net income of $813,000, or 8 cents per diluted share, and non-GAAP net income of $1.1 million, or 10 cents per diluted share.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: both of which were up significantly on a year-over-year basis.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Adjusted EBITDA was $1.5 million, up 47% from $1 million in the preceding third quarter.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: In our fourth quarter results, we also included some one-time acquisition-related charges of $105,000, and we also recognized sales and performance-related expenses and bonuses of $595,000.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Following the close of the quarter, We filed a S3 shelf registration statement for the potential sale of up to $100 million in our comms stock, debt securities, or warrants.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: The shelf is intended to give the company flexibility to take advantage of our financing opportunities in the future to fund general corporate purposes or future acquisitions and is effective for three years.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: In regard to our pending acquisition of Microlab announced last week, we intend to pay the purchase price through a combination of cash on hand and borrowing from a bank facility.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: We do not plan to use the shelf to finance this acquisition.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Our balance sheet remains strong and included cash and cash equivalents of $13 million and working capital of $31.3 million at the end of the quarter.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Comparing to the preceding third quarter, cash was up slightly by $475,000 and accounts receivable increased by $2.9 million.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: As well, the cash balance here does not yet include a portion of the ERC credit.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: The remaining receivable related to the ERC is included as part of our other current assets, which is $1.7 million, and we expect to receive in the first half of the calendar year.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Moving on, we continue to see momentum build around new business, as evidenced by our improved bookings and growth in our backlogs.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Backlog was $33.3 million at October 31, 2021, on fourth quarter bookings of $22.9 million.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: As of today, our backlog currently stands at $30.5 million.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: Looking ahead, given the first quarter is seasonally our toughest quarter, we expect revenue to come down a bit compared to the fourth quarter, but certainly up significantly over last year's Q1.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: And looking to the coming fiscal year, As Rob mentioned, we expect year-over-year revenue growth to be north of 10%, which will put our total fiscal 2022 sales to at least $63 million.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: This growth rate does not include any microlab revenue or any additional significant hybrid fiber orders.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: These would be upside to that number as well.

speaker_title_P: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, RF Industries
presentation_text: This concludes my discussion.
